title: Spying on opposition would be cheating the world, says South Africa attack coach
text:
South Africa have condemned any incidents of spying with a coach saying that the perpetrators are “cheating the world”.

On Tuesday, England head coach Eddie Jones claimed that their training sessions were filmed from a high-rise flat in the build-up to their World Cup semi-final against New Zealand in Yokohama on Saturday.

Jones’ allegations have cast a shadow over both semi-finals and attack coach Mzwandile Stick seemed genuinely disgusted at the very thought of employing such clandestine tactics.

“We try to keep the game clean as South Africans,” Stick said. “We try when we coach the players to lead by the World Rugby standards. Doing something like that off the field is not who we stand...
description: South Africa have condemned any incidents of spying with a coach saying that the perpetrators are “cheating the world”.
